title: Code Generation Technical Debt
context: AI code generators produce syntactically correct, functional code at unprecedented speed. Teams ship features faster than ever. But the generated code optimizes for immediate correctness, not long-term maintainability. It doesn't know your architecture, your conventions, or your future plans. Six months later, the codebase is a patchwork of locally correct but globally incoherent patterns.
hypothesis: AI code generation accelerates development without increasing technical debt.

chain.root: Use AI to generate production code at scale

children.label: More code means larger maintenance surface area
Duplicated logic that AI doesn't recognize as redundant
Reviewers trust AI output and skim rather than analyze
AI-generated code lacks the intent documentation humans provide
Nobody fully understands code they didn't write or think through
Teams avoid refactoring and add more layers instead
Velocity appears high while foundation erodes
Eventually a rewrite becomes necessary — the debt cliff

dontIf: Your codebase is already struggling with technical debt
Your team lacks strong code review culture and architectural guidelines
ifYouMust: Enforce architectural decision records (ADRs) that AI must conform to
Require AI-generated code to pass the same review standards as human code
Run automated architecture fitness functions in CI
Budget explicit refactoring sprints to address AI-generated debt

alternatives.name: AI for tests only
alternatives.note: Let AI generate tests while humans write production code

alternatives.name: AI-assisted refactoring
alternatives.note: Use AI to improve existing code rather than generate new code

alternatives.name: Strict scaffolding
alternatives.note: AI generates within pre-defined templates and patterns only

sources.title: GitClear: Coding on Copilot 2024
sources.note: AI-assisted code shows 39% increase in code churn and significant rise in moved/deleted code

sources.title: IEEE Software: Technical Debt in AI-Assisted Development
sources.note: Analysis of how AI code generation accelerates technical debt accumulation

sources.title: Uplevel: GitHub Copilot Impact Study
sources.note: No statistically significant improvement in PR merge time despite faster code generation

sources.title: Martin Fowler: Technical Debt Quadrant
sources.note: Framework for understanding inadvertent debt — AI-generated code falls in reckless/inadvertent quadrant

falsifiability: Codebases with heavy AI code generation show equal or lower technical debt metrics than human-only codebases over 18+ months
Code churn rates for AI-generated code are comparable to human-written code
Teams using AI code generation can onboard new developers as quickly as teams that don't

seo.description: AI code generators increase output +55% but drive code churn up 39% and double onboarding time. The debt compounds silently until a rewrite becomes inevitable.
